com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs
Class MRS

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.MRS

public class MRS
extends java.lang.Object

An MRS representation class that provides MRS manipulation utilities.

Naming convention:
In an example EP:
[
_poet_n_1_rel<4:8>
LBL: h10
ARG0: x6 [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG IND: + ]
]
type(EP) label: _poet_n_1_rel
feature: LBL/ARG0
value: h10/x6
FvPair (feature/value pair): LBL: h10
extra type (Var): [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG IND: + ], h10 (simplified value)
extra feature: PERS/NUM/IND
extra value: 3/SG/+

Author:
Xuchen Yao

getAnsPhrase

public java.lang.String getAnsPhrase(java.lang.String sent)
Get the answer phrase from the original input sentence sent. During transformation, the answer phrase is kept in the field ansCrange. This method gets the answer phrase by returning the substring of sent. For Y/N questions, it always returns "yes".

Parameters:
sent - the original input sentence where this MRS comes from
Returns:
an answer phrase

setAnsCrange

public void setAnsCrange(java.util.HashSet<EP> dEPS)
Set the character range of answer term by extracting the range of dEPS. Usually dEPS comes from the replaced set of EP during transformation.

Parameters:
dEPS - a set of EPs that represent answer terms

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Plain text output of this MRS and dependencies for each EP.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

postprocessing

public void postprocessing()
Clean up and re-build dependencies for this MRS. After manipulating (decomposition, transformation) an MRS, this method should be called to rebuild the charVariableMap and EPS' dependencies.

getEPSvalueList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEPSvalueList()
Get a list of the values of all EPs.

In an EP like:
[ _like_v_1_rel<5:10>
LBL: h8
ARG0: e9
ARG1: x6
ARG2: x10
]
h8 is label. e9, x6, x10 are handles

Returns:
an ArrayList containing all the values of EPS (empty if not found)

getEPbefore

public EP getEPbefore(int cfrom,
                      int cto)
Get the EP before cfrom and cto. This method is mainly used to find out the preposition before a time/location term. For instance, "in Germany", one EP is _IN_P_REL ("in"), the other is PROPER_Q_REL ("Germany"), feeding cfrom and cto with those of PROPER_Q_REL returns the _IN_P_TEMP_REL EP. There can be multiple EPs matching cfrom and cto but only the first one is returned.

Parameters:
cfrom - the starting position in characters
cto - the starting position in characters
Returns:
an EP (null if it was found)

getEPbyParallelIndex

public EP getEPbyParallelIndex(MRS copyMrs,
                               EP copyEP)
Retrieve the same EP as copyEP in copyMrs. This is used when the current MRS is a copy of copyEP, then we return the same EP as copyEP by computing parallel index in the current MRS.

Parameters:
copyMrs - an MRS which the current MRS is copied from
copyEP - one EP in copyMrs
Returns:
a corresponding EP the "same" to copyEP

getLoLabelFromHconsList

public java.lang.String getLoLabelFromHconsList(java.lang.String hiLabel)
Given a hiLabel, retrieve the corresponding loLabel in the list. For instance, the list contains a "h1 qeq h2" relation, then given a hiLabel "h1", the function returns the loLabel "h2"

Parameters:
hiLabel - a hiLabel
Returns:
a corresponding loLabel in the list, or null if not found

getHiLabelFromHconsList

public java.lang.String getHiLabelFromHconsList(java.lang.String loLabel)
Given a loLabel, check the corresponding HiLabel in the list. For instance, the list contains a "h1 qeq h2" relation, then given a loLabel "h2", the function returns the hiLabel "h1"

Parameters:
loLabel - a loLabel
Returns:
a corresponding hiLabel in the list, or null if not found

determineHiLowEP

@Deprecated
public static java.util.ArrayList<EP> determineHiLowEP(java.util.ArrayList<EP> eps,
                                                                  MRS mrs)
Deprecated. this is only used in the first version of com.googlecode.mrsqg

Give an EP ArrayList, determine which is the HiEP, and return the index (0 or 1).

Parameters:
eps - an EP ArrayList
mrs - the MRS in which eps comes from
Returns:
an ArrayList with the 0th the HiEP and the 1st the LoEP, or null if not found

changeFromUnkToNamed

public void changeFromUnkToNamed()
Change the type name of unknown words to avoid generation error. When FSC is input to cheap, NEs are labeled as NAMED_UNK_REL, which generates the following error in LKB generation: Warning: invalid predicates: |named_unk_rel("Washington DC")| Changing named_unk_rel to NAMED_REL solves this (hopefully).

preventInvalidPredicate

public void preventInvalidPredicate()
Deprecated. In ERG 1004 this problem is solved.

This is used to check whether there are any basic_yofc_rel to prevent the following error: Warning: invalid predicates: |basic_yofc_rel("1980")|, |basic_yofc_rel("1982")|. The above is usually caused by: 
          [ _in_p_temp_rel<0:1>
            LBL: h3
            ARG0: e4
            ARG1: e2
            ARG2: x6 [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG IND: + ] ]
          [ proper_q_rel<1:2>
            LBL: h7
            ARG0: x6
            RSTR: h9
            BODY: h8 ]
          [ basic_yofc_rel<1:2>
            LBL: h10
            ARG0: x6
            ARG1: u11
            CARG: "1999" ]

 One solution is to change to:
          [ _in_p_rel<0:1>
            LBL: h3
            ARG0: e4
            ARG1: e2
            ARG2: x6 [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG ] ]
          [ number_q_rel<1:2>
            LBL: h7
            ARG0: x6
            RSTR: h9
            BODY: h8 ]
          [ card_rel<1:2>
            LBL: h10
            ARG0: x6
            ARG1: i11 [ i PERS: 3 NUM: PL ]
            CARG: "1999" ]

normalizeUnknownWords

protected void normalizeUnknownWords()
Normalize unknown words in an MRS, see erg/lkb/sample.mrs or a sample file and *mrs-normalization-heuristics* in erg/lkb/mrsglobals.lsp for the rules. This function is only called when parsing an MRS

getExtrapair

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getExtrapair()
Get all the extra pairs in this MRS. Extra pairs are sth. like [TENSE: PRES].

Returns:
an ArrayList of all extra pairs

Returns:
an ArrayList of FvPair (empty if not found)

setAllSF2QUES

public void setAllSF2QUES()
Set the sentence force of all events variables to "QUES". Theoretically only the events of predicates should be set, but practically all of them are set.

setSF2QUES

public void setSF2QUES()
Set the sentence force of the main event variables to "QUES".

extractByLabelValue

public static MRS extractByLabelValue(java.lang.String label,
                                      MRS mrs)
Deprecated. The same functionality can be achieved by DMRS operation.

Extract a new MRS from mrs, containing only EPs that are indirectly associated with label. currently, the label should only be a predicate's label. for instance, an EP looks like: 
 [ _like_v_1_rel<5:10>
 LBL: h8
 ARG0: e9
 ARG1: x6
 ARG2: x10
 ]
then all EPs with x6 and x10 as ARG* (indirectly) are extracted. Those EPs make a new MRS.

Parameters:
label - the label value of the predicate, such as "h8"
mrs - the original mrs to be extracted from
Returns:
a new MRS with only EPs concerning label

extractByEPandArg0

public static MRS extractByEPandArg0(EP targetEP,
                                     MRS mrs)
Deprecated. The same functionality can be achieved by DMRS operation.

Extract a new MRS from mrs, containing only EPs that are directly associated with label. This method is used when the label isn't a predicate's label. for instance, an EP looks like: 
 [ _like_v_1_rel<5:10>
 LBL: h8
 ARG0: e9
 ARG1: x6
 ARG2: x10
 ]
then all EPs with x6 and x10 as ARG0 (directly) are extracted. Those EPs make a new MRS.

Parameters:
targetEP - an EP to find references for
mrs - the original mrs to be extracted from
Returns:
a new MRS with only EPs concerning targetEP

extractByLabel

public MRS extractByLabel(java.lang.String label,
                          EP exceptionEP)
Deprecated. The same functionality can be achieved by DMRS operation.

This method returns a new MRS containing all EPs referred by label, both directly or indirectly. The new MRS doesn't contain any EPs referred by exceptionEP. Note this method doesn't set the event index of the whole MRS. You have to do it yourself.

Parameters:
label - a h* label
exceptionEP -
Returns:
a new MRS, or null if none matches

extractRangeByXValue

public int[] extractRangeByXValue(java.lang.String value,
                                  EP exceptionEP)
This method returns the range of EPs referred by value, both directly or indirectly. For instance, in sentence "John likes green apples and red oranges.", if exceptionEP is "and", and value is R-INDX of exceptionEP, then it returns the range of "red oranges".

Parameters:
value - a x* value
exceptionEP -
Returns:
a range {cfrom, cto}

cleanHCONS

public void cleanHCONS()
Clean up the HCONS list. Any HCONS pairs, such as "h1 qeq h2", whose hiLabel and loLabel can't be both found in the EPS, are removed. This step is very important in avoiding unnecessary memory consumption in LKB, see this post.

getAllReferredLabelByEP

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getAllReferredLabelByEP(EP ep)
This method retrieves the labels of all EPs which are referred by the ARG0 values of ep.

Parameters:
ep - An EP which has ARG* entries
Returns:
a HashSet of labels referred by the ARG0 of this ep (empty if not found).

markDeletionByEPref

protected void markDeletionByEPref(EP ep)
Deprecated. this function is only used by another deprecated function

Mark deletion of one EP by judging its ARG0 doesn't refer to any ARG* values of ep

Parameters:
ep - An EP which has ARG* entries

Returns:
success status

public boolean removeEPbyFlag(boolean flag)
remove all EPs whose flag is set to flag from the EPS list. After a successful removal, postprocessing() is called.

Returns:
a boolean success status

generateUnusedLabel

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generateUnusedLabel(int num)
Generate a list of the index for unused labels.

Parameters:
num - the number of unused labels to return
Returns:
an ArrayList containing num members, such as "7", "8", "9", ...

toMRXstring

public java.lang.String toMRXstring()
output as an MRX String. LKB cannot read properly indented XML so a one-line string is output.

Returns:
a one-line string with an <mrs> element

toXML

public void toXML(java.io.OutputStream os)
Output MRS to an OutputStream os.

Parameters:
os - an OutputStream

buildCoref

public void buildCoref()
This method builds cross references for an MRS representation. After reading/parsing an MRX, the extra type (Var) of some arguments are referenced individually. This method make them refer to the same one.

mapCharacteristicVariables

public void mapCharacteristicVariables()
Maps each characteristic variable with an EP, such as that "x28" maps with: 
           [ "_cat_n_1_rel"<8:9>
            LBL: h32
            ARG0: x28 ]

buildDependencies

public void buildDependencies()
Build dependencies for each EP, find out their governors and dependents.

getDependentEP

public static EP getDependentEP(java.util.ArrayList<EP> list)
Find out the dependent EP from a list of EP. Usually this list of EP has the same label but all except one governs the dependent EP

Parameters:
list - An non-empty ElementaryPredication list
Returns:
the dependent EP, or null if not found

                                       int level)

ep - an EP
level - initial level offset, usually 0

an integer number

doDecompositionbyEP

public java.util.HashSet<EP> doDecompositionbyEP(EP rEP,
                                                 EP eEP,
                                                 boolean relaxEQ,
                                                 boolean keepEQ)
Wrapper code for decompose(HashSet, HashSet, boolean, boolean). All related EPS are set to a false flag. Must call removeEPbyFlag(boolean) to remove them.

doDecomposition

public java.util.HashSet<EP> doDecomposition(java.util.HashSet<EP> rEPS,
                                             java.util.HashSet<EP> eEPS,
                                             boolean relaxEQ,
                                             boolean keepEQ)
Wrapper code for decompose(HashSet, HashSet, boolean, boolean). All related EPS are set to a false flag. Must call removeEPbyFlag(boolean) to remove them.

Parameters:
rEPS - a set of target EPS
eEPS - a set of exception EPS
relaxEQ - whether to relax /EQ to /NEQ
keepEQ - whether to keep EPs with /EQ relations with rEPS
Returns:
a set of EPs related to rEPS

label - the label for the target EP
eEP - a single exception EP

decompose

public java.util.HashSet<EP> decompose(java.util.HashSet<EP> rEPS,
                                       java.util.HashSet<EP> eEPS,
                                       boolean relaxEQ,
                                       boolean keepEQ)
Decompose this MRS. This algorithm find out all EPs that are related to rEPS. See detailed explanation in the author's master thesis

Parameters:
rEPS - a set of target EPS
eEPS - a set of exception EPS
relaxEQ - whether to relax /EQ to /NEQ
keepEQ - whether to keep EPs with /EQ relations with rEPS
Returns:
a set of EPs related to rEPS

                                   EP excepEP)
Deprecated. replaced by full DMRS operation

Parameters:
label - a String indicating an EP, starting with an "h" or "x".
excepEP - an exception EP, whose flag is always set to true.
